docs.title: Welcome to OVPanel
docs.text:
OVPanel is an open-source, powerful and modern web application designed to create, manage, and monitor OVPN clients across multiple servers. It provides an intuitive dashboard, automation tools, and API integration to make server and user management simple and efficient.

Get Started View on GitHub

docs.title: ✨ Key Features
docs.text:
👥 Easy Client Management

Create and manage OVPN clients with just a few clicks through an intuitive interface.

🖥️ Multi-Server Support

Manage multiple servers from a single dashboard with real-time monitoring and statistics.

🔒 Secure API

Powerful REST API for automation and integration with your existing tools and workflows.

📱 Mobile-Friendly

Beautiful, responsive web interface that works perfectly on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

📊 Real-Time Monitoring

Track server performance in real-time.

⚡ Fast & Efficient

Optimized performance with modern technologies for lightning-fast operations.

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text:
Whether you're managing a single server or running a large-scale VPN service, OVPanel helps you do it effortlessly.

  1. Install Panel - Set up the control panel on your server
  2. Configure Panel - Customize settings and preferences
  3. Install Nodes - Add additional servers to your network
  4. Explore Awesome Projects - Discover community tools and integrations

docs.title: ⚙️ Configuration
docs.text:
You can edit OV Panel by configuring the .env file to match your environment. This file controls admin credentials, panel settings, SSL options, and developer options.

During installation the installer will prompt for the main values (admin username/password, port path) and populate the .env automatically. Editing the file manually is optional — use these steps if you want to change values after installation:

  1. Open the .env file in a text editor (example):
sudo nano /opt/ov-panel/.env

  1. Make your changes and save the file.

  2. Restart the panel service :

bash <(curl -s https://raw.githubusercontent.com/primeZdev/ov-panel/main/install.sh)

The .env file is located in to (/opt/ov-panel/.env).

docs.title: 🧾 Example .env file
docs.text:
# Admin Credentials
ADMIN_USERNAME=admin
ADMIN_PASSWORD=admin

# UVICORN Settings
HOST=0.0.0.0
URLPATH=dashboard
VITE_URLPATH=dashboard
PORT=9000

### Ssl Configuration
# SSL_KEYFILE="/path/to/keyfile"
# SSL_CERTFILE="/path/to/certfile"

### Development Settings
# DEBUG=INFO
# DOC=True

### Security Settings
JWT_SECRET_KEY="random string here" # change this to a secure random string
JWT_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES=86400 # in seconds

docs.title: 🧍‍♂️ Admin Credentials
docs.text: Variable Description ADMIN_USERNAME The username for logging into the OV Panel. ADMIN_PASSWORD The password for the admin account.

docs.title: ⚙️ Panel Settings
docs.text:
Variable Description URLPATH and VITE_URLPATH The path used in your panel URL (default: dashboard). PORT The port number the OV Panel runs on (default: 9000).

Example access URL:

http://your-server-ip:9000/dashboard

docs.title: 🔐 SSL Settings (Optional)
docs.text:
Variable Description SSL_KEYFILE Path to your SSL private key file. SSL_CERTFILE Path to your SSL certificate file.

To enable HTTPS, uncomment both lines in your .env and provide valid certificate paths.

Example:

SSL_KEYFILE=/etc/letsencrypt/live/yourdomain.com/privkey.pem
SSL_CERTFILE=/etc/letsencrypt/live/yourdomain.com/fullchain.pem

docs.title: 🛠 Developer Options (Optional)
docs.text: Variable Description DEBUG Logging level. One of: DEBUG, INFO (default), WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL. Example: DEBUG=INFO. Set to DEBUG for verbose output useful when troubleshooting. DOC API documentation

docs.title: 🚀 Panel Installation Guide
docs.text: OV-Panel can be easily installed on your server using the official automated script. This guide will walk you through everything you need to get started.

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
Requirement Description 💻 Operating System Ubuntu 20.04+ / Debian 11+ (Recommended) 🖥️ CPU 1 core minimum (2+ cores recommended) 🧠 RAM 2 GB minimum (4 GB recommended) 💾 Storage 10 GB free space 🌐 Network Stable internet connection 🔑 Access Root access or user with sudo privileges 🌍 Domain Domain or subdomain pointed to server IP (optional but recommended)
  • tip "Pro Tip" Using a domain with SSL certificate is highly recommended for security and better user experience.

docs.title: Step 1: Run the Installation Script
docs.text:
Connect to your server via SSH and run the following command:

bash <(curl -s https://raw.githubusercontent.com/primeZdev/ov-panel/main/install.sh)

  • info What happens during installation?

    • Install required dependencies
    • Download and configure OV-Panel
    • Set up the database
    • Create initial configuration files
    • Start the panel service

  • Once installation is complete, you can access your panel:

    • http://YOUR_SERVER_IP:port/path

docs.title: Option 1: Using Certbot (Free SSL)
docs.text:
# Install Certbot
sudo apt update
sudo apt install certbot

# Generate certificate
sudo certbot certonly --standalone -d your-domain.com

docs.title: Option 2: Using Cloudflare
docs.text:
1. Point your domain to Cloudflare DNS
  2. Enable "Full (strict)" SSL mode in Cloudflare
  3. Use Cloudflare Origin Certificate

docs.title: Update Panel Configuration
docs.text:
After obtaining your SSL certificate, update the .env file:

nano /opt/ov-panel/.env

Add or update these lines:

SSL_KEYFILE=/path/to/your/certificate.crt
SSL_CERTFILE=/path/to/your/private.key

Restart the panel:

bash <(curl -s https://raw.githubusercontent.com/primeZdev/ov-panel/main/install.sh)

docs.title: 🔧 Post-Installation
docs.text:
After successful installation, proceed to:

  • Install Nodes - Add servers to your network
  • Configure Panel - Customize settings and preferences
